contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTopPic|Jczabala 1931.jpg|140px}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[Athletics at the Summer Olympics|athletics]]}} {{MedalCountry|{{ARG}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalGold | [[1932 Summer Olympics|1932 Los Angeles]] | [[Athletics at the 1932 Summer Olympics - Men's marathon|Marathon]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Juan Carlos Zabala''' -aka: "'''El [[Ñandú]] Criollo'''"- (October 11, 1911 – January 24, 1983) was an [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[Athletics (sport)|athlete]], winner of the [[Marathon (sport)|marathon race]] at the [[1932 Summer Olympics]]. ==Biography== Born in [[Rosario]], Juan Carlos Zabala played [[Football (soccer)|football]] and [[basketball]] and did some [[swimming (sport)|swimming]], before he met his future coach [[Alexander Stirling]] in 1927. Zabala ran his first marathon at the end of October, 1931. Ten days later he ran a new [[world record]] in 30 km (1:42:30.4). Later, before the [[1936 Summer Olympics]], Zabala would run a new world record in 20 km (1:04:00.2). Zabala's high peak was the [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] [[Olympic Games|Olympics]]. Zabala ran in the leading group almost the entire distance. With just four kilometres to run, he broke free to finish 20 seconds ahead of [[Sam Ferris]] from Great Britain. Zabala also participated at the [[Berlin]] Olympics, gaining sixth place at the 10,000 m, but couldn't defend his Olympic Champion title at the marathon race. Zabala got the lead from the start, but abandoned the race after 33 km when the main group caught him. Juan Carlos Zabala died in [[Buenos Aires]], aged 71. ==References== *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/za/juan-carlos-zabala-1.html sports-reference] <br> {{Footer Olympic Champions Marathon Men}} {{Footer WBYP Marathon Men}} {{Footer Košice Peace Marathon Champions Men}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zabala, Juan Carlos}} [[Category:1911 births]] [[Category:1983 deaths]] [[Category:Argentine marathon runners]] [[Category:Olympic athletes of Argentina]] [[Category:Olympic gold medalists for Argentina]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1932 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1936 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:People from Rosario, Santa Fe]] [[Category:Košice Peace Marathon winners]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in athletics (track and field)]]
